reasons_to_visit.details: September often boasts mild, sunny days (avg highs ~21°C/70°F), ideal for sightseeing, strolling along Lake Geneva, and enjoying the last warmth before autumn.
Tourist numbers decrease significantly from July/August, offering a more relaxed experience at museums (Art & History, Red Cross), attractions (Jet d'Eau), and on boat trips.

Experience local wine culture. Villages in the Geneva countryside (like Russin) often host 'Fête des Vendanges' (Harvest Festivals) on weekends, celebrating the grape harvest with tastings and events.
Geneva's cultural life resumes after summer. Check for the end of La Bâtie festival, new seasons at the Grand Théâtre or Victoria Hall, and gallery openings.
Witness the first hints of autumn color along the lake, in parks like La Grange or Eaux-Vives, and on the slopes of Mont Salève. Temperatures are great for walks.
Benefit from potentially better prices for flights and accommodation compared to the high summer months, while still enjoying pleasant weather.

reasons_to_reconsider.details: Temperatures drop noticeably in the evenings (lows ~11-13°C/52-55°F). Weather becomes more variable with an increased chance of rain showers or windy ('bise') days.
Days become significantly shorter compared to summer, reducing available time for late afternoon/evening outdoor exploration.
Lake Geneva water temperature cools rapidly, making swimming less appealing or feasible for most. Lakeside lidos (Genève Plage) may close.

reasons_to_reconsider.reason: Major Events Can Still Draw Crowds
reasons_to_reconsider.details: While generally less crowded than summer, specific events like harvest festivals or the end of La Bâtie can draw significant local and visitor numbers to certain areas.
Packing adaptable clothing layers (including sweaters and a light/medium jacket, possibly waterproof) is essential for changing conditions.

weather.precipitation: Mix of warm, sunny days and increasing chance of rain showers. Generally feels like pleasant late summer.
weather.general_tips: Pack layers: t-shirts, long sleeves, sweater/light jacket. Comfortable shoes. Sunglasses still needed. A light waterproof is wise.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate. Noticeably less crowded than August, but still pleasant weather attracts visitors. La Bâtie events can be busy.
tourism_level.pricing: Shoulder season pricing offers better value than peak summer.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Lovely transition from summer. Still lively with outdoor dining and lake activities possible on good days. Cultural events pick up.

events_holidays.name: La Bâtie - Festival de Genève (Potential End)
events_holidays.date: Usually ends early September (check exact dates)
events_holidays.description: Catch the final days of this major multidisciplinary arts festival featuring music, dance, theatre, and performances at various venues across Geneva.
events_holidays.notes: Check the official La Bâtie program for final schedule and ticket information.

events_holidays.name: Geneva 'Jeûne Genevois' (Genevan Fast)
events_holidays.date: Thursday following the first Sunday of September
events_holidays.description: Unique Geneva public holiday. Shops, banks, offices are closed. Traditionally marked by eating plum tart ('tarte aux pruneaux').
events_holidays.notes: Plan for widespread closures. Most tourist attractions and restaurants remain open, but check hours.

unique_experiences.activity: Attend a La Bâtie Festival Event (if dates align)
unique_experiences.description: Experience a unique performance – music, dance, theatre – as part of this eclectic and well-regarded arts festival.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Book tickets in advance for popular shows. Check venue locations.

unique_experiences.where: Departing from Jardin Anglais / Mont-Blanc / Eaux-Vives
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy a scenic cruise on the lake during potentially beautiful late summer weather. Full schedules usually still operate.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check CGN website for schedules (towards Nyon, Yvoire, etc.). Bring layers for the breeze.

unique_experiences.activity: Walk or Cycle Along the Rhône
unique_experiences.where: Paths leading west from Jonction area
unique_experiences.description: Explore the pathways along the Rhône river as it flows out of the city, enjoying nature and potentially seeing early autumn colors.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Relatively flat paths. Bike rentals available in the city.

unique_experiences.description: Wander the historic heart of Geneva with fewer crowds, enjoying the pleasant temperatures and lingering outdoor cafe seating.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Wear comfortable shoes. Visit St Peter's Cathedral and climb the towers for views.

weather.precipitation: Increased likelihood of rain showers and cooler days as autumn progresses. Sunny spells still occur. Daylight hours shorten noticeably.
weather.general_tips: Layers essential. Waterproof jacket highly recommended. Scarf might be useful for cooler evenings/windy days.

tourism_level.crowds: Moderate to Low shoulder season. City feels calmer.
tourism_level.pricing: Good shoulder season value generally available.
tourism_level.overall_atmosphere: Clear transition to autumn. Crisp air, changing leaves become more apparent. Focus shifts slightly more towards indoor/cultural activities.

events_holidays.name: Fête des Vendanges (Wine Harvest Festivals)
events_holidays.date: Various weekends, often mid/late Sept (check specific communes like Russin)
events_holidays.description: Local festivals in Geneva's wine-growing villages celebrating the grape harvest with parades, wine tasting, food stalls, and music.
events_holidays.notes: Requires checking specific dates/locations (e.g., 'Fête des Vendanges Russin'). Accessible by regional train/bus. Can be very popular locally.

events_holidays.name: Start of Theatre/Opera/Concert Season
events_holidays.description: Check schedules for Grand Théâtre de Genève, Victoria Hall (Orchestre de la Suisse Romande), Comédie de Genève for new season openings.
events_holidays.notes: Book tickets online in advance for desired performances.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit a Fête des Vendanges (if dates align)
unique_experiences.where: Wine villages like Russin, Satigny (check specific events)
unique_experiences.description: Experience an authentic local harvest festival. Sample Genevan wines, enjoy the festive atmosphere, and see the vineyards.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Check transport options (train/bus). Bring cash. Can be crowded.

unique_experiences.activity: Visit the International Red Cross Museum (MICR)
unique_experiences.description: Explore the impactful history of humanitarian action. A thought-provoking indoor activity.

unique_experiences.where: Parc La Grange, Parc des Eaux-Vives, Parc des Bastions
unique_experiences.description: Enjoy the changing scenery in Geneva's beautiful parks as autumn leaves turn golden and red.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ideal for relaxed walks. Combine Parc des Bastions with seeing the Reformation Wall.

unique_experiences.description: Look for menus featuring late summer/early autumn produce, possibly mushrooms or early game, paired with local Genevan wines.
unique_experiences.practical_tips: Ask for recommendations for local wine pairings (Chasselas, Gamay).
